episodeTitle: Showdown Between Cooks! Sanji vs. Ramen Kenpo
episodeTitleJapanese: コック対決！サンジVSラーメン拳法
episodeTitleRomanized: Kokku Taiketsu! Sanji VS Rāmen Kenpō
description: Aboard the Puffing Tom sea train, Sanji faces off against Wanze and his bizarre Ramen Kenpo fighting style. Meanwhile, Franky battles CP9's newest member Nero on the train's roof, and Sogeking uses octopus shoes to reach Robin's compartment.

events.title: Sanji vs Wanze Battle Begins
events.description: Sanji decides to stay behind in train car 4 to fight Wanze, telling Franky and Sogeking to go ahead and prioritize rescuing Robin. Wanze prepares to use his Ramen Kenpo techniques to stop all three intruders.
events.significance: Sets up the main battle of the episode between two cooks with vastly different fighting philosophies.

quotes.text: You two go on ahead. Rescuing Robin is the top priority.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji prioritizes the mission over his own battle

events.title: Ramen Beam Debut
events.description: Wanze swallows a large amount of flour and fires hardened noodles from his nose like bullets, creating the Ramen Beam attack. The sharp noodles are made from special Alloy Flour that hardens into metal-like consistency.
events.significance: Introduces Wanze's signature Ramen Kenpo fighting style and demonstrates the bizarre nature of his cooking-based combat.

events.title: Sogeking's Octopus Shoes Plan
events.description: When Franky mockingly calls him 'Stupid Slimy Squid King', Sogeking gets the idea to use his octopus shoes from Skypiea to walk along the side of the sea train to reach Robin's window directly.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sogeking/Usopp's resourcefulness in repurposing old gadgets for new situations and provides a clever solution to reach Robin.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky's insult inadvertently gives Sogeking the idea to use octopus shoes

events.title: Franky vs Nero Begins
events.description: Franky engages CP9's newest member Nero on top of the train. Nero reveals he has mastered four of the six Rokushiki techniques: Soru, Geppo, Kami-e, and Rankyaku.
events.significance: Introduces the conflict between Franky and Nero, showcasing both fighters' abilities on the dangerous rooftop of a moving train.

events.title: Sanji's Escalope Debut
events.description: Sanji attempts to use Escalope, a jumping kick aimed at Wanze's forehead. However, Wanze counters with another Ramen Beam attack, forcing Sanji back.
events.significance: Shows Sanji developing new techniques during the battle, though Wanze's unconventional fighting style proves difficult to counter with standard kicks.

events.title: Fire Skate Technique
events.description: Wanze uses his special roller skates with circular blades that ignite from friction, creating the Fire Skate technique - a flaming kick attack enhanced by his burning skates.
events.significance: Demonstrates Wanze's versatility in combat, combining his cooking equipment with martial arts.

events.title: Wanze's Spiral Weakness
events.description: Wanze becomes dizzy when he sees Sanji's spiral eyebrows, revealing an unusual weakness. Despite this, he continues fighting by creating his ultimate defense.
events.significance: Adds a comedic element to the battle while revealing that even Wanze's bizarre abilities have weaknesses.

quotes.text: Your swirly eyebrows made me dizzy!
quotes.speaker: Wanze
quotes.context: Wanze reveals his weakness to spiral patterns

events.title: Men's Formal Suit Debut
events.description: Wanze eats an entire sack of flour and creates his ultimate technique: Ramen Kenpo Ogi: Men's Formal Suit. He forms a giant suit of armor made entirely of hardened ramen noodles around his body, providing both defense and enhanced offensive capabilities.
events.significance: The ultimate technique of Ramen Kenpo, representing Wanze's full power and forcing Sanji to reconsider his approach to the battle.

events.title: Tonkotsu Spank
events.description: Using the Men's Formal Suit, Wanze delivers a powerful straight punch called Tonkotsu Spank. The noodle armor enhances the force of his blows while trapping opponents in the sticky noodles.
events.significance: Demonstrates the offensive capabilities of the Men's Formal Suit armor.

events.title: Sanji Decides to Use His Hands
events.description: Frustrated by Wanze using food as a weapon and seeing that his kicks alone won't break through the ramen armor, Sanji makes a rare exception to his 'never use hands in battle' rule. He realizes the armor is made of food and they're in a kitchen, so he'll treat this as cooking rather than fighting.
events.significance: A significant character moment where Sanji breaks one of his core fighting principles, showing his anger at the disrespect of food and his adaptability in battle. This is one of the very few times Sanji uses his hands in combat.

quotes.text: You're using food to fight... I'll make you eat all those noodles!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's anger at Wanze's disrespect for food motivates his decision

events.title: Hocho Sabaki and Epluchage Debut
events.description: Sanji borrows Wanze's kitchen knives and unveils Hocho Sabaki (Kitchen Knifework), a technique where he uses knives instead of kicks. He performs Epluchage, skillfully peeling away Wanze's ramen armor like preparing food.
events.significance: One of the most unique moments in Sanji's fighting history, showcasing his culinary skills as combat abilities. This demonstrates that Sanji's true expertise is as a chef, and when he treats combat as cooking, he excels.

events.title: Franky's Strong Hammer
events.description: During his battle with Nero on the train roof, Franky attempts to use his Strong Hammer attack. However, Nero dodges it using his Kami-e technique.
events.significance: Shows Franky's combat capabilities against a CP9 agent, though Nero's Rokushiki training allows him to evade the attack.

events.title: Sogeking Reaches Robin
events.description: Using his octopus shoes to walk along the side of the speeding sea train, Sogeking successfully reaches Robin's window and taps on it, making contact with her for the first time since her capture.
events.significance: A crucial moment in the rescue operation, as one of the Straw Hats finally reaches Robin directly. Sets up the emotional confrontation to come.

themes.description: The episode centers on a clash of culinary philosophies - Sanji's deep respect for food versus Wanze's weaponization of it. Sanji's anger at seeing food used as a weapon motivates him to break his own rules.
themes.symbolism: The ramen armor represents the corruption of cooking's purpose, while Sanji's knife work represents treating food with proper respect even in combat.
culturalReferences: French culinary terminology in Sanji's techniques (Escalope, Epluchage)

themes.description: Sanji volunteers to stay behind and handle Wanze alone, prioritizing the team's mission to rescue Robin over his own safety. This shows the crew's willingness to trust each other with separate tasks.
themes.symbolism: The separation of the team across different train cars symbolizes how each member must face their own challenges while working toward the common goal.

themes.description: Sogeking's creative use of octopus shoes and Sanji's adaptation to use knives both demonstrate the importance of adapting to unusual situations with whatever tools are available.
themes.symbolism: The octopus shoes from a past arc returning to solve a current problem shows how past experiences and preparation pay off.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji is forced to make a rare exception to his combat rules by using his hands and kitchen knives. This showcases his culinary expertise as a legitimate combat skill and reinforces his respect for food as a core character value.
keyActions: Makes the decision to use his hands in combat
Defeats the ramen armor using culinary skills

characterSpotlights.development: Wanze is fully characterized as a bizarre but formidable opponent who uses his cooking skills in the exact opposite way from Sanji - as pure weaponry rather than art.

Battles Sanji as a fellow cook

characterSpotlights.role: Supporting character progressing the rescue mission
characterSpotlights.development: Shows Usopp's resourcefulness and dedication to rescuing Robin, using creative solutions to overcome obstacles.

Travels along the side of the speeding train

characterSpotlights.development: Begins his fight with CP9's Nero, showcasing his combat abilities and setting up the next episode's confrontation.
keyActions: Engages Nero in combat on the train roof

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded the Sanji vs Wanze fight with additional comedic moments and technique showcases not present in the manga.

trivia.fact: This is one of the very rare occasions where Sanji uses his hands in combat. Throughout the series, he maintains a strict code of only using his legs to fight, reserving his hands for cooking.
In the Funimation dub, Wanze references the 1963 film 'It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World' during his introduction.
Wanze's Ramen Kenpo style uses special 'Alloy Flour' that hardens into metal-like consistency when processed through his nose.
The octopus shoes Sogeking uses in this episode were previously introduced during the Skypiea arc, showing continuity in Usopp's gadget inventory.
